alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 4:40PM MST until February 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with 1 to 3 inches from Lovell to Basin. Local totals 6 to 10 inches in the vicinity of Thermopolis. North wind gusting 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Cody Foothills, North Bighorn Basin, Southwest Bighorn Basin and Southeast Bighorn Basin. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday, although much of the snow will diminish Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Low visibility due to the snow and wind, especially on roads oriented west to east such as US Highway 16 east of Cody.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
